Articles.Content:
I was looking (once again ^^) at a bunch of wikipedia's article on rocket and suddenly I began to wonder what are the favourite rockets of my fellow kerbonauts. Mine is Titan IIIE

If you have a reason, feel free to tell it Personally, I just find Titan III really beautiful
Saturn V. It's just a monstrosity of rocket engineering. Plus, it took it us to the Moon. Also, it was principally designed in Huntsville, Alabama...my home state.

Also, it was principally designed in Huntsville, Alabama...my home state.

That's the best of all reasons I which rockets were designed in my little town ^^

I was looking (once again ^^) at a bunch of wikipedia's article on rocket and suddenly I began to wonder what are the favourite rockets of my fellow kerbonauts. Mine is Titan IIIE

If you have a reason, feel free to tell it Personally, I just find Titan III really beautiful

Titan IIIE is pretty Kerbal; it's got more boosters attached with actual, in real life struts.
It's either the STS, or the Delta II.

Toss up between the R-7 family and Atlas V family. The former for the long service life and actually seeing something like mass production. The latter for being nifty from a performance perspective, even if they failed to make things cheaper.

Edited April 30, 2013 by UmbralRaptor
Delta II could have a lot more SRBs than Titan III ^^

I've always liked the look of the R-7 Semyorkas. There's the whole "MOAR BOOSTERS" look of the thing, the weird claw like clamps that hold them in place, and growing up in the '80's they were sort of far off and mysterious. I lived in Florida near the KSC (That's K for Kennedy, not Kerbal) and I could see other rockets whenever I could pester my parents enough to go visit, but the Soviet boosters weren't well known, only appearing on posters my dad would sometimes bring home from work.
My favorite? ummm

I have a list of favorite Rockets that starts with the Aggregat 4, without it there would be no rockets, then the Saturn V for obvious reason, the Energia and the Ariane 5.

Edited April 30, 2013 by Canopus
Space Launch System. It's pretty much the Shuttle and the Saturn V combined, that can take us to the Moon, an asteroid, and Mars!
I like the Proton. It's big, it's (now) reliable, it's cheap, and it's man-rated if you have the balls to sit on top of several hundred tons of face melting chemicals.

Space Launch System. It's pretty much the Shuttle and the Saturn V combined, that can take us to the Moon, an asteroid, and Mars!

But can it take you to the beach on a saturday?

But can it take you to the beach on a saturday?

If you don't mind filling the water with bits of rocket, or getting there via space, sure!

My favorite is the Betelgeuse-1 Heavy which I built myself..

OH you mean REAL life..

First is Falcon-9 and the whole system they have with Dragon. It's a modern system, and if they get the Grasshopper system working, any rocket that utilizes it will be pretty much 100% reusable. Also, the capsule is named Dragon, my favorite of all mythical creatures, or creatures in general:

Second favorite would probably have to be the Soyuz, because it's just so cool looking, and I love how the OTVs look:

Third would have to probably be the N1. It's so much like everything I build in KSP..I get this big idea, this dream in my head of a huge, amazing rocket, I get all excited and ready to go, and I put it on the pad and there's a failure within the first 5 seconds:

Right after that, it's pretty much a tie between the Titan-II (specifically the later ones used in Gemini) and Saturn V. I like them because of the classic look of both of them. Titan-II is so elegantly simple, and Saturn-V is just such a massive rocket it's hard to dislike. If you don't know which is which, shame on you and get out:

Falcon 9.

And I can't wait to see the Falcon Heavy.

Chang Zheng rocket family, the chinese built rocket family used as workhorse for the chinese space program. CZ-3B is my favourite for different reasons, but if I had to choose one for aesthetics, I'd say CZ-2F, the man rated one.http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_March_2F

The Mercury-Redstone Rocket

Because both the rocket and lauch gantry look awesome and the name contains 2 of my favourite elements - Mercury and Redstone.
For design i pick the Delta IV Heavy, true kerbal style.

1. Ares V

2. Saturn V

3. R-7 (and derivatives)

4. Falcon 9 and Heavy

...
Falcon 9 Heavy will look pretty damn cool, I have to agree with you ^^
Titan IV because it just looks like what I build all the time.
